landscape_overview.title: Global Semaglutide Clinical Trial Landscape
landscape_overview.description: Semaglutide has an extensive and mature clinical development footprint spanning metabolic, cardiovascular, and exploratory neurobehavioral indications, with multiple late-stage programs.

phase_distribution.title: Trial Phase Distribution (All Indications)
phase_distribution.description: The predominance of Phase III trials reflects clinical maturity in core metabolic indications, while earlier phases support lifecycle expansion into new therapeutic areas.

sponsor_profile.title: Sponsor & Research Profile
sponsor_profile.description: Public-sector sponsorship highlights emerging scientific interest beyond commercial metabolic indications.

aud_focus.title: Alcohol Use Disorder (AUD) â€“ Clinical Trial Focus
aud_focus.description: Early-stage clinical investigations are evaluating semaglutide's impact on alcohol craving, consumption behavior, and relapse risk through central reward-pathway modulation.

key_trials.title: Key AUD Trials & Design Characteristics

data.primary_endpoints: Alcohol craving scores, drinks/week, relapse frequency

key_trials.description: Current AUD trials are signal-seeking in nature and not powered for regulatory approval, but provide critical mechanistic validation.

signal_interpretation.title: Clinical Signal Interpretation (AUD)
signal_interpretation.observed_trends: Reduced alcohol craving, improved impulse control, lower reward-driven consumption
signal_interpretation.description: Signal strength remains preliminary but aligns with preclinical and real-world behavioral observations seen in GLP-1 treated populations.

development_gaps.title: Development Gaps & Next Steps
gaps: No Phase III AUD trials initiated to date
Regulatory endpoints for addiction indications remain variable
Opportunity to design relapse-prevention focused pivotal trials
